ovdesc.p: New mechanism T24.UPDATE replaces the old mechanism of Patches. This is to ensure that all clients are in accordance with a particular GA Release and thereafter. This is easier to maintain and will help in encouraging the clients to take the updates on weekly basis rather than wait for Service Packs.

Service Packs followed the upgrade process where the entire bins and libs were replaced and clients were not keen on taking them .Now these updates will be product specific and have less number of fixes enabling the clients to take them regularly. The dependency constraints would be removed which was a drawback in the patch mechanism.
A latest T24.UPDATE for a particular product also has the fixes from previous t24.updates of the same product

desc.p: RECORD.NAME will be populated only if USE.DIMENSION is set to YES.
FILE.NAME and RECORD.NAME form a associated multi value set.
Contains the current accounts path.
System maintained field.
Free flow text.

Contains file names like F.EB.ERROR,F.FILE.CONTROL.

Key to T24.UPDATE.RELEASE.
Key should be of this format.
GA.REL.NO_EB.COMPONENT_SEQ.NO
Specifies the TTS or HD reference that is present in the c.d attributes.
Alphanumeric field.
Maximum of 35 characters allowed.
Contains the version of the update that is installed.
System maintained field.
Contains the current system date of when the update was released.
System maintained field.
Specifies the change document number.
Should be a valid c.d in pvcs and should belong to
workset/T24 release for which we are going to create the update
Specifies the type of change document pretaining to the change document number.
Allowed values are BG,CI,EF,EN
This field will hold the information whether the data record of this updates has been released or not. Noinputtable field
Possible values are Y or N or C
N = No, Data Records not yet Released only the libraries and Binaries are copied
Y = Yes, Data Released Successfully but Not yet updated in SPF
C = Completed, Updates Successfully completed
Description about the update that is to be released.
Langauge multi value field.
Specifies the nature of fix that is present in the c.d attributes.

SV.FILE.NAME and SV.RECORD.NAME form a associated multi value set

Format is TERMINAL.NO_OPERATOR.

This field is to store the parameter option used with updater utility when installing respective updates
Valid values :
DataOnly - Updater utility triggered with parameter option 'DataOnly' to deploy data records from updates
desc.P: Blank if updater utility triggered without any parameter options to deploy both object code and data records
